page.title: 07CLEMENTS FARM, BRICKENDON
page.content: A typical dairy farm of the area, Clements Farm,approx. 350 acres, has been farmed by the Vigus family for over 50 years. Wheat,barley & oats are grown in rotation on arable land using seasonal contracted labour. A herd of 100 Friesian cows,well known for their large milk yield,are tended by the herdsman who lives in one of the farm cottages,and has worked at the farm for 19 years. For him a working week is approx.50 hours and milking takes about 3 hours a day and is done by machine. The cattle are freeze branded using liquid nitrogen to cool the irons. About six weeks later white hairs grow on the beasts' black rumps and the numbers branded are plainly visible across the fields! A great improvement to the old hot iron method!
